column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There were approximately 2440 export and 350 young cattle penned representing a decrease of 250 head week-on-week. The usual buying group was present and operating in a dearer market. Quality declined with more secondary cattle and a large proportion of cows. Young cattle lifted up to 30c/kg with processors competing for finished lots and feedlots and graziers working to secure suitable lines. Grown steers to feed lifted 10c/kg while bullocks lifted 4c/kg. Manufacturing steers sold firm to 7c/kg dearer. Cows lifted 5c to 15c/kg. Heavy bulls held firm. 

Vealers sold from 300c to 388c/kg. Yearling trade steers made between 336c and 422c/kg. Yearling heifers to the trade sold between 330c and 388c/kg. Grown steers made from 350c to 404c/kg. Bullocks sold from 372c to 418c/kg. 

Heavy Friesian manufacturing steers made between 268c and 356c with the crossbred portion between 311c and 385c/kg. Most light and medium weight cows sold between 202c and 275c/kg. Heavy weight cows made mostly from 237c to 342c/kg. Heavy bulls sold from 302c to 344c/kg. 

Market reporter: Brendan Fletcher.
